name: Urban Studies
descriptions: The Urban Studies minor develops a multi-disciplinary exploration of cities by examining the organization of urban space, the varied dimensions of urban life, and the challenges of 21st-century urban change.

Through a partnership with the Center for Urban Studies, students explore real-world problems affecting the local community. The minor benefits students across all majors with understanding of strategic city composition, applicable to business development, social change, and real estate.

courses: GEOG 10013 - An Urban World: Introduction to Urban Studies - 3 hrs.

electiveCourses.description: 6 hours from core courses (ECON 40463 Regional and Urban Economics, GEOG 30713 Urban Geography, POSC 30103 Urban Politics, HIST 30803 Urban History), 3 hours from service learning/internship/research options, and 6 hours from approved Urban Studies courses. Must select from at least 3 disciplines, max 9 hours from any single discipline.
courses: GEOG 40323 - Urban & Business Applications of GIS

internship.description: URBS 30013 - Internship in Urban Studies, or POSC 40960 - Civic Literacy Internships. Service learning options also available through SOCI 30213 Applied Sociology and HIST 30813 Texas Communities Oral History Project.

features: Partnership with Center for Urban Studies
Service learning and internship component built into requirements
Courses drawn from Geography, Economics, Political Science, History, Criminal Justice, and Sociology
